thread.title: Celebrity Tottenham supporter Jude Law to attend Monaco's Champions League clash with Manchester City
thread.title_full: Celebrity Tottenham supporter Jude Law to attend Monaco's Champions League clash with Manchester City

author: Liam Corless
title: Celebrity Tottenham supporter Jude Law to attend Monaco's Champions League clash with Manchester City
text:
Sport Celebrity Tottenham supporter Jude Law to attend Monaco's Champions League clash with Manchester City City are leading 5-3 from the first leg but actor Law will be hoping the French side can turn the tie around Share Jude Law will be in attendance for Monaco vs Manchester City (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Renowned Spurs supporter Jude Law will be in the stands when Monaco host Manchester City in the Champions League on Tuesday night. 
The Ligue 1 leaders are trailing 5-3 from the first leg but have scored a mammoth 123 goals this season and will fancy their chances of overturning that deficit on home soil. 
One man who will be hoping they can complete a comeback is Tottenham supporter Law. 
He has six tickets in the home end for the match and, according to French media outlet RMC Sport , "his heart will beat for Monaco". 
City manager Pep Guardiola has insisted his side will go for broke at the Stade Louis II in their bid to reach the last eight for a second consecutive season. Law will be cheering on Monaco on Wednesday night (Photo: Getty) City have a 5-3 advantage from the first leg... (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) ... but Monaco proved they are dangerous by scoring three away goals at the Etihad (Photo: Stu Forster) 
The Spaniard is convinced his side can become kings of Europe playing in a cavalier style and says he cannot play any other way. Read More Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says he will not be thinking of personal glory in Champions League 
“Can we win the Champions League in that way? Yes, sure,” said Guardiola. “It’s the only way I know and it’s going to be another fantastic game. 
“Monaco are a team created to attack and our team is created to attack - or at least to score goals. So in that way it will be a great game.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
